Text:
Leaving Triple Triad Invitational Parlor. The tournament will end if even one party member declines a rematch.
Proceed?

To perform a rematch, all party members must accept the challenge. The tournament will end if even one party member declines the rematch.
Proceed?
Opponents have been paired up for the next round. Please wait while participants make their preparations.
Your opponent was offline. You have won this round by default.
Matches still in progress. Please wait.

The following rules have been set for this tournament: StringParameter(2),・StringParameter(2) ・StringParameter(3),・StringParameter(2) ・StringParameter(3) ・StringParameter(4),・StringParameter(2) ・StringParameter(3) ・StringParameter(4) ・StringParameter(5))> Rules cannot be changed once the competition has begun. Proceed?

All participants are ready to play.
The match will commence shortly.

Opponents have been paired up for the next round.
The match will commence shortly.

All matches for this round have ended.
Now tallying results.
Available from <sheet(ENpcResident,1044839,0)> in Wonder Square upon completing the main scenario quest “<If(GreaterThan(IntegerParameter(2),0))>???<Else/><String>StringParameter(1)</String>.</If>”
Parties will be formed with players who have selected the same languages.
Close window and discard all changes without saving?

Participate in duties without meeting the minimum party member requirements. ※Level sync and item level sync are disabled and role requirements are ignored. ※Defeating enemies will yield no EXP or items. ※Equipment will not gain spiritbond. ※Certain duties will apply special enhancements to players. ※Only certain duties allow unrestricted parties. ※Only the party leader's settings are applicable. ※Vote abandon may be used at any time.

Item level sync all gear to the duty's minimum requirement. ※When using an unrestricted party, player and item levels will be synced. ※When using an unrestricted party, gear will still gain spiritbond. ※When using an unrestricted party, enemies will still yield EXP and items. ※Can only be selected when using a preformed party meeting party size requirements or an unrestricted party. ※Only the party leader's settings are applicable.
The Need, Greed, Pass system is employed for loot drops. ※Loot rules for some duties may be set to Greed Only.
All party members must select Greed.
The party leader determines individual loot distribution.

※Lootmaster and Greed Only can only be selected when using a preformed 　party meeting party size requirements or an unrestricted party. ※Only the party leader can change loot rules. ※Loot rules are void upon leaving an instance.
Only available when using a preformed party meeting party size requirements or an unrestricted party.
Specify languages to be used during party matching.
Check the boxes of the languages you are comfortable using. The ★ indicates your current client language setting. ※This setting is shared in all duty matching.
※Depending on the languages chosen, matching times may 　increase. If you are experiencing overlong wait times, 　you may want to consider different language settings.
Close window and discard all changes without saving?

Leave current duty. ※A Duty Finder penalty will be incurred in the following cases: 　You are first to leave a matched party before duty is complete. 　You are first to leave a preformed party in less than 10 minutes.
Initiate a vote to abandon current duty. ※Parties must wait 15 minutes from duty commencement 　before voting.
Search for new party members in the event party composition falls below the minimum size.
Options set in Duty Finder settings. ※Only settings for current duty are available for review.
Option only available after completing duty.
※Option only available if weekly reward is unclaimed.
※Phase selection does not entail the skipping of phases.

※The “Duty Complete” option is only available for previously 　completed duties. ※The “Duty Completion” option is only available if the 　weekly reward has yet to be obtained. ※Practice phase selection does not entail the actual skipping 　of phases. ※If the registration period overlaps with the weekly reset, 　registration will be canceled. ※If 1 to 4 members have already received the weekly reward, 　or if a member logs out or disconnects, the number of rewards 　will be reduced. No coffers will appear if 5 or more members 　have received the reward.

The duty selected is beyond your current story progression. The preceding duty will be skipped and its weekly reward lost. Proceed?

By passing on <If(LessThanOrEqualTo(IntegerParameter(2),1))><ennoun(Item,2,IntegerParameter(1),1,1)><Else/>the <Num>IntegerParameter(2)</Num> <ennoun(Item,3,IntegerParameter(1),1,1)></If>, you will no longer have the option to select Need or Greed. Proceed?

Select the recipient of the loot.

You do not meet the following exercise requirements:
The following class quests must first be completed:
※Available from Mylla in the Gladiators' Guild located on the Steps of Thal in Ul'dah.
※Available from Wyrnzoen in the Marauders' Guild located on the upper decks of Limsa Lominsa.
You do not meet the following requirements:

Progress Record Progress within the latest Savage raids is periodically saved, allowing for continuation of the duty from that point. Progress is reset every week on at 12 p.m.a.m. (Earth time). Party Progress A party's starting point in the raid is determined by the leader's past progress. As long as all other conditions are met, players who have not progressed as far as the leader may still participate in the duty. If a party member's progress was less than that of the leader, then progress will be updated to match. If a party member's progress is beyond that of the leader, that member's progress will remain unaffected. Reward Restrictions Players will not earn rewards for completing phases they have already completed. Coffer quantity will vary based on the total number of party members who have already completed the duty. When participating in the latest Savage raid with a matched party, duty rewards may change based on the progress level of matched members. Job Distribution Parties formed with the Raid Finder do not allow for two members with the same job unless certain conditions are met. DPS jobs are divided into the following roles: Melee DPS, Physical Ranged DPS, Magical Ranged DPS, and Not Specified. When the raid purpose is set as “Duty Completion,” the jobs that fall into Not Specified must be different from the ones which fill the other three DPS roles. When the raid purpose is set to “Practice,” overlapping between specified and unspecified DPS jobs is allowed. Loot Rules & Languages Loot rules and Language settings are imported from current Duty Finder settings. Penalties Penalties for withdrawing from duties are shared between all matched content.
Set whether or not you wish to join a party in progress looking for members. This feature allows for party matching without using the Duty Finder. ※Setting active only when playing solo.
Skipping duty. The corresponding weekly reward will be made available again after the weekly reset.
Kick StringParameter(1) from the Novice Network. This command should only be executed in cases of spamming or harassment.

Your name, the name of the player being kicked, and the reason will be displayed to everyone on the channel. If your decision is challenged, you may face punishment. Kicked mentors cannot return to the Novice Network for 3 hours, kicked new adventurers for 30 minutes (Earth time). Proceed?
Accept terms and kick the specified player.

You can now receive your mentor certification. As a mentor, you are expected to actively perform the following: 1. Provide gameplay advice for new adventurers and other players. 2. Be an exemplar for player etiquette. 3. Invite new adventurers to the Novice Network, and answer their queries in the chat channel. Accepting mentor certification will grant you access to the Novice Network and Duty Roulette: Mentor, as well as earn you a bonus to experience points when grouping with a new adventurer. ※Mentors can participate in the Novice Network regardless of online status. You will also be able to register for Duty Roulette: Mentor, but your status will automatically switch to “Mentor” once inside the instance. ※Inappropriate mentor behavior may be reported.
Accept terms and become a mentor.

Do you wish to cancel all of your current mentor certifications? By renouncing your mentor status, you forfeit access to the Novice Network and Duty Roulette: Mentor, and will also lose the bonus to experience points earned when grouping with a new adventurer. Mentor certification will be unavailable for 30 days following cancellation.
Accept terms and renounce your mentor status.

Your online status will be set to “Mentor.” Other players will be able to identify you as a mentor while this setting is active. As a mentor, you are expected to actively perform the following: 1. Provide gameplay advice for new adventurers and other players. 2. Be an exemplar for player etiquette. 3. Invite new adventurers to the Novice Network, and answer their queries in the chat channel. ※Inappropriate mentor behavior may be reported.
Search for a new adventurer or returner.

You have received an invite to the Novice Network from the <Icon>78</Icon>mentor <String>StringParameter(1)</String>!

The Novice Network is a place where beginning players can share their experiences and pose questions on adventuring to participating mentors. Be sure to take full advantage of this channel, but also remember to be polite and respectful while doing so!
ビギナーチャンネルに参加しますか？ ビギナーチャンネルは一度参加した後でも、 以下の方法で退出することができますので、 気軽に参加してみてください。 ビギナーチャンネル参加者リストの「退出」ボタンを押下 テキストコマンド「/**** off」を実行

Once an invite to the Novice Network has been declined, participation in the channel will not be allowed until another invite is received.

Click the box below to automatically decline all further invites.

Once the Novice Network has been left, participation in the channel will not be allowed until another invite is received. ※Leaving the Novice Network does not remove the New Adventurer/Returner status.

Much and more has happened in Eorzea while you were away. To help those such as yourself reacclimate to the ever-changing realm, the Twelve have prepared a most generous boon─the Returner's Bounty.

Accepting this divine aid will provide you with the tools required to make that quick return to form, including experience bonuses for partying with <Icon>78</Icon>mentors, as well as full access to the Novice Network, a chat channel dedicated to lending a helping hand.

All 95Returners are granted full access to the Novice Network. In addition to returners, this chat channel is only open to 78mentors and 77new adventurers, and provides players with a place to ask questions and seek help. The Novice Network can be left at any time by pressing the Leave button in the Novice Network List, or by using the text command .
Declining the Returner's Bounty will remove the Returner status. Returner status cannot be reachieved without first meeting several requirements. Proceed?
Mentors can rejoin the Novice Network at any time by using the text command via the Novice Network List or by using the text command /novicenetwork on.
Display both pet hotbar and hotbar 1.
Hide duty list during instanced duty.
Hide duty list during non-instanced duty.
Enable WXHB with simultaneous <Icon2>14</Icon2> and <Icon2>15</Icon2> double tap.
Return to XHB after WXHB input.
Enable toggling between NQ and HQ text.
XHB transparency when not in use:
Display achievements nearing completion as login notification.
Display character portraits with battle dialogue widget.
Show party member portraits at the start of duty.
Display portraits in the player commendation window.
Disable right-click selection of player characters.
Disable right-click selection of non-player characters in battle.
Display remaining time of status effects.
Hide nearby players when close to quest NPCs.
Also hide nearby party members and friends.
Hide nearby players when interacting with quest NPCs.
Also hide nearby party members and friends.
Enable tilt while riding a ground mount.
Enable tilt while riding a flying/swimming mount.

You have yet to obtain this Yo-kai as a minion.
Yo-kai Medals can be traded for Yo-kai minions.
Yo-kai Medals can be obtained in select FATEs.

※The wandering executive has returned to
　his own realm with all remaining Yo-kai Medals.
Unable to retrieve data while in an instance.
Only select from favorited minions. (At least 2 must be favorited)
Set mount roulette to select from favorites only.
At least 2 mounts must be favorited before using the Mount Roulette. ※Stabled chocobos cannot be summoned via this method.
Use a pinch of treated crystal sandIntegerParameter(1) pinches of treated crystal sand to foster your quickened anima's growth?

Proceed and your fixed party save data will be converted to matched party save data. Matched party save data still allows for the creation of preformed parties as long as the party is formed before returning to the deep dungeon, and the progression of all members is identical. Any open party slots will be filled automatically via the matching system. All special items (pomanders) will be lost upon data conversion. Scores will not be recorded for matched parties. ※Converted data cannot be restored to its original state.

Proceed and your save data will be deleted, allowing you reentry to the deep dungeon from floor 1. Floor progression and character level will be reset, but aetherpool arm and gear strength will remain unchanged. ※Data cannot be restored once deleted.
